body_html:
The reason is 1.4 branch defaults to CUDA 8, and if you do not have cuda8 available on the image.
@angersson actually fixed this internally to avoid the infinite loop there.

You should be able to get around this by setting TF_CUDA_VERSION to 9.0, and TF_CUDNN_VERSION to 7 in the image.
In the future, we should have this controlled by ARGS in the image.

In the future, we should have this controlled by ARGS in the image.
body:
The reason is 1.4 branch defaults to CUDA 8, and if you do not have cuda8 available on the image.
@angersson actually fixed this internally to avoid the infinite loop there.

You should be able to get around this by setting TF_CUDA_VERSION to 9.0, and TF_CUDNN_VERSION to 7 in the image.
In the future, we should have this controlled by ARGS in the image.
